comments.text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 5.1; rv:2.0b10) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0b10
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 5.1; rv:2.0b10) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0b10

Browser window is not redrawn on second monitor after a screensaver exits. The problem might only occur after the display has been powered down.

Reproducible: Sometimes

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Maximize Firefox on the secondary display (may not be required, but that's how I'm using it.)
2. Wait for the screensaver to turn on. I'm using 3D Flower Box with a password.
3. Wiggle the mouse and enter the password.

Actual Results:  
The Firefox toolbar and tabs are redrawn, but the client area below is black.

Changing a tab will cause a redraw. Dragging another window over Firefox will cause a redraw in the areas it passes over.

Expected Results:  
The client area redraws.

LG Flatron Wide monitor at 1680 by 1050 pixels.
comments.author: WayneGJohnston@gmail.com
comments.creator: WayneGJohnston@gmail.com

The problem still occurs. I do have a better reproduction case that fails every time.

Open any application and put it on the either monitor.
Open Firefox and put it on either monitor. It can be maximized or restored.
Give the other application focus (i.e. click on it's window).
Press Ctrl-Alt-Del to display the Windows security dialog
Press Esc to close the dialog.
Observe that the Firefox window does not redraw.
Click in the Firefox window and observe that it redraws.

If Firefox has focus then the problem does not occur.
comments.author: WayneGJohnston@gmail.com
comments.creator: WayneGJohnston@gmail.com

comments.raw_text:
I am experiencing this problem.  The following procedure almost always causes the problem.

Steps to reproduce:
"Restore" a Firefox window, making it not full screen.
Click any other open window, removing focus from Firefox window.
Press Ctrl-Alt-Delete to show "Windows Security" window.
Press Esc to return to Windows.  Don't even need to lock the screen.
The last used Firefox window, which currently doesn't have focus, will be all black.
Mousing over the window may restore images of navigation buttons.
Dragging another window over the black window will reveal the contents of the Firefox window where the dragged window passed over.
Giving the Firefox window will restore its entire image.

On rare occasions, this procedure has failed to give a black screen.  I believe it only functions properly on the first screen lock / screen unlock cycle after Firefox has been started.  Try following procedure to avoid the black screen:
Close all Firefox windows.
Start Firefox.
Restore the Firefox window (non full screen) and switch to another open window.
Press Ctrl-Alt-Delete then Esc.
Though the Firefox window doesn't have focus, it properly redraws after screen lock or accessing the Windows Security window, but only the first time after Firefox has been started.  Ctrl-Alt-Delete, Esc again will give a black screen.

System config:
Windows XP SP3 (an old, dirty installation)
Firefox 5.0.1, upgraded from 3.6.x.
nVidia GeForce GTX 460
nVidia Forceware driver version 6.14.12.8026, installed today
nVidia Forceware driver date 8-3-2011
All installed Firefox add-ons and themes disabled
about:support page attached to this thread.

I believe this is a duplicate of bug 638334.

comments.text:
I restarted in Safe Mode. The problem did not occur.

I restarted in Safe Mode and checked all the options on the Safe Mode start up dialog, then clicked Make Changes and Restart. The problem occurred. Safe mode must be doing something beyond this. Any suggestions as to what else I can change to help debug this?

I then restored my settings and bookmarks. This was pretty easy. Congratulations on making that work well.

comments.author: fmdevelopertim@gmail.com
comments.creator: fmdevelopertim@gmail.com
comments.text: Matti -> Anything else that safe mode does that you think could impact this?

The safemode disables all extensions, the hwa and the jit.
The jit is very unlikely to cause problems like this one. It's either extensions or hwa and in this case i would bet that it's the hwa. 
Reporter: Did you restart Firefox after disabling the hwa in the options ?
comments.raw_text:
The safemode disables all extensions, the hwa and the jit.
The jit is very unlikely to cause problems like this one. It's either extensions or hwa and in this case i would bet that it's the hwa. 
Reporter: Did you restart Firefox after disabling the hwa in the options ?

comments.text:
I'm also seeing this with FF20 since installing the latest nVidia drivers (I think the older drivers were *quite* old, I didn't think to check).  Dual-screen, WinXP-SP3.

The <Alt-Ctrl-Del><Esc> sequence does if for me every time when Firefox isn't focussed;  the focussed (non-FF) window doesn't have to be on the other screen, and only the most recently focussed (effectively also top-most) FF window goes black (if more than one are open).

Side note:  bug 638334 might be a dup. of this.
comments.raw_text:
